messages.title: Keep Simon fighting for us!
messages.content: Simon Hughes has been fighting for Bermondsey, Borough and the Elephant for over 30 years.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Affordable homes, jobs and the NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Simon Hughes has always fought for affordable homes and jobs, opposing wealthy property developers and supporting Guy's hospital.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The tactical consideration is implied by the necessity to 'keep out' Ed Miliband's Labour.

issues.economy: Simon Hughes has helped to fix the economic mess left by the last Labour government.
issues.education: Simon Hughes has stopped the Tories from introducing schools for profit and allowing employers to fire at will.
issues.health: Simon Hughes led the successful fight to save Guy's hospital when Labour closed our A&E; and has cut taxes for local workers by £800 and helped to create 6,210 new apprenticeships in Southwark since 2010.

housing.content: Simon Hughes has always fought for affordable homes, opposing the trend of property being given into wealthy property developers.

politicalExperience.role: MP for Bermondsey, Borough and the Elephant
politicalExperience.achievements: Fought for affordable housing, jobs, NHS, led the fight to save Guy's hospital, cut taxes for local workers, created apprenticeships.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes Simon Hughes' long-standing involvement in the local community and his efforts to maintain services and oppose austerity measures.
